sen.j: 高橋 道八（たかはし どうはち）は京焼（清水焼）の窯元の一つで、陶芸家の名跡。
sen.e: Dohachi TAKAHASHI is one of potteries of Kyo yaki (Kyoto style ceramic art, or kiyomizu-ware), and a family name for ceramic artists.
Dohachi TAKAHASHI is one of potteries of Kyo yaki (Kyoto style ceramic art, or kiyomizu-ware), and is a family name for ceramic artists.
Dohachi TAKAHASHI is one of potteries of Kyo yaki (Kyoto style ceramic art, or kiyomizu-ware), and is a family name for ceramic artists.

sen.j: 江戸時代後期より作陶に携わり、特に茶道具、煎茶器の名品を輩出し続けてきた。
sen.e: They have been engaged in the production of ceramic wares since the late Edo period, and creating masterpieces of especially tea utensils and tea sets for green tea.
They have been engaged in the production of ceramic ware since the late Edo period, creating masterpieces of especially tea utensils and tea sets for green tea.
They have been engaged in the production of ceramic ware since the late Edo period, creating masterpieces of especially tea utensils and tea sets for green tea.

sen.j: 当代は8代目。
sen.e: The current head is the eighth generation.
The current head is the eighth generation.
The current head is the eighth generation.

sen.j: 歴代
sen.e: The successive heads
The successive heads

sen.j: 初代 道八（元文5年（1740年）- 文化 (日本)元年（1804年））
sen.e: The first Dohachi (1740-1804)
The first Dohachi (1740-1804)
The first Dohachi (1740-1804)

sen.j: 伊勢国伊勢亀山藩出身。
sen.e: Born in Isekameyama Domain, Ise Province.
Born in Isekameyama Domain, Ise Province.
Born in Isekameyama Domain, Ise Province.

sen.j: 字「周平」名「光重」。
sen.e: The azana (adult male nickname) 'Syuhei', name 'Mitsushige'.
The azana (adult male nickname) 'Syuhei', name 'Mitsushige'.

sen.cmt: ルールに従って、カンマ、ピリオドをクオーテーションマークの中に入れました。

sen.j: 号は「松風亭空中」とも称する。
sen.e: The go (pseudonym) is 'Shofutei Kuchu'.
The go (pseudonym) is 'Shofutei Kuchu'.
He also called himself 'Shofutei Kuchu.'
sen.cmt: 号の訳、変更カンマ、ピリオドをクオーテーションマークの中に入れました。

sen.j: 次男のため士分を離れ、京都に出て陶器職人となる。
sen.e: Since he was the second son in the family, he abandoned the samurai class and went to Kyoto to become a craftsman of ceramic wares.
Since he was the second son in the family, he abandoned the samurai class and went to Kyoto to become a craftsman of ceramic wares.
Since he was the second son in the family, he abandoned the samurai class and went to Kyoto to become a craftsman of ceramic wares.

sen.j: 後独立し粟田口に開窯。
sen.e: Later, he became independent and opened a pottery in Kyo no Nanakuchi (seven entrances of Kyoto).
Later, he became independent and opened a pottery kiln in Kyo no Nanakuchi (seven entrances of Kyoto).
Later, he became independent and opened a pottery kiln in Awataguchi.
sen.cmt: 京の七口→粟田口 ウェブで確認し、原文訳文ともに訂正しました。

sen.j: 活躍期は煎茶隆盛期でもあり、数多くの煎茶器の名品を制作した。
sen.e: As his floruit was also prosperous period for green tea, he created a large number of masterpieces of tea sets for green tea.
As his floruit was also a prosperous period for green tea, he created a large number of masterpiece tea sets for green tea.
As his floruit was also a prosperous period for green tea, he created a large number of masterpiece tea sets for green tea.

sen.j: 自らも池大雅、上田秋成、売茶翁らの文人と交際。
sen.e: He associated with literati such as IKE no Taiga, Akinari UEDA, and Baisao.
He associated with literati such as IKE no Taiga, Akinari UEDA, and Baisao.
He associated with literati such as IKE no Taiga, Akinari UEDA, and Baisao.

sen.j: 南画を趣味とする。
sen.e: His enjoyed nanga (a school of painting originating in China) as a hobby.
His enjoyed nanga (a school of painting originating in China) as a hobby.
He enjoyed nanga (a school of painting originating in China) as a hobby.

sen.j: 初代三男、仁阿弥道八の弟。
sen.e: The third son of the first Dohachi, a young brother of Dohachi NINNAMI.
The third son of the first Dohachi, a young brother of Dohachi NINNAMI.
The third son of the first Dohachi, a young brother of Dohachi NINNAMI.

sen.j: 幼名「熊蔵」名「光吉」。
sen.e: The childhood name 'Kumazo', name 'Kokichi'.
The childhood name 'Kumazo', name 'Kokichi'.

sen.cmt: カンマ、ピリオドをクオーテーションマークの中に入れました。

sen.j: 奥田頴川や兄・仁阿弥道八の元で修行の後独立。
sen.e: After he got trained by Eisen OKUDA and his brother, Dohachi NINNAMI, he went independent.
After he was trained by Eisen OKUDA and his brother, Dohachi NINNAMI, he became independent.
After he was trained by Eisen OKUDA and his brother, Dohachi NINNAMI, he became independent.

sen.j: 尾形乾山にあやかり「尾形」姓を名乗る。
sen.e: His surname 'OAGATA' was named after Kanzan OGATA.
His surname 'OAGATA' was named after Kanzan OGATA.
His surname 'OAGATA' was named after Kanzan OGATA.

sen.j: 青華、色絵、青磁を得意とし、煎茶器（特に急須、湯沸、茶碗）に名品が多い。
sen.e: Seika (ceramics with blue patterns on white backgrounds), iroe (painting or colored artwork) and celadons were his specialties, and he left many masterpieces of those in tea sets for green tea (especially kyusu (small teapots), teakettles and tea bowls).

Seika (ceramics with blue patterns on white backgrounds), iroe (painting or colored artwork) and celadons were his specialties, and he left many masterpieces of those in tea sets for green tea (especially kyusu - small teapots), teakettles and tea bowls).

Seika (ceramics with blue patterns on white backgrounds), iroe (painting or colored artwork) and celadons were his specialties, and he left many masterpieces of those in tea sets for green tea (especially kyusu - small teapots, teakettles and tea bowls).

sen.e: The second son of the first Dohachi.

sen.e: The eldest son of the second Dohashi.

sen.j: 幼名「道三」、名「光英（みちふさ）」。

sen.j: 号「華中亭」「道翁」。
sen.e: The go 'Kachutei' and 'Doo'.
The go 'Kachutei' and 'Doo'.

sen.cmt: 号の表現、変更カンマ、ピリオドをクオーテーションマークの中に入れました。

sen.j: 嘉永3年、高松藩に招かれ「讃岐窯」を開窯。
sen.e: He was invited to Takamatsu Domain and opened the pottery 'Sanuki kiln' in 1850.
sen.cmt: 年号を西暦に統一しました。
sen.e: He was invited to the Takamatsu Domain and opened a pottery 'Sanuki kiln' in 1850.

sen.j: 明治2年、佐賀藩の招聘により有田焼技術指導。
sen.e: He was invited from Saga Domain and gave technical guidance for Arita ware in 1869.
sen.cmt: 年号を西暦に統一しました。
sen.e: He was invited from tje Saga Domain and gave technical guidance for Arita ware in 1869.
He was invited from the Saga Domain and gave technical guidance for Arita ware in 1869.

sen.j: 仁和寺宮より法橋に任じられる。
sen.e: He was assigned to hokkyo (the third highest rank for Buddhist priests) by Ninnajinomiya.
He was assigned to hokkyo (the third highest rank for Buddhist priests) by Ninnajinomiya.
He was assigned to hokkyo (the third highest rank for Buddhist priests) by Ninnajinomiya.

sen.j: 青花、白磁の製作にも成功。
sen.e: He successfully created seika (ceramics with blue patterns on white backgrounds) and white porcelain also.
He successfully created seika (ceramics with blue patterns on white backgrounds) and white porcelain also.
He successfully created seika (ceramics with blue patterns on white backgrounds) and white porcelain also.

sen.j: 晩年は祖父の桃山窯に引退。
sen.e: He retired to his grandfather's pottery, Momoyamayo, in his later years.
He retired with his grandfather's pottery, Momoyamayo, in his later years.
He retired with his grandfather's pottery, Momoyamayo, in his later years.

sen.j: 技法としては青磁、雲鶴模様、三島手、刷毛目を得意とし、煎茶器の名品を多数製作した。
sen.e: His technical specialties were celadons, unkaku moyo (pattern with clouds and cranes), mishimade (tea bowls with corded designs), and hakeme (ceramics with white brush marks), and he created a great number of masterpieces of those in tea sets for green tea.

His technical specialties were celadons, unkaku moyo (pattern with clouds and cranes), mishimade (tea bowls with corded designs), and hakeme (ceramics with white brush marks), and he created a great number of masterpieces of those in tea sets for green tea.

His technical specialties were celadons, unkaku moyo (pattern with clouds and cranes), mishimade (tea bowls with corded designs), and hakeme (ceramics with white brush marks), and he created a great number of masterpieces of those in tea sets for green tea.

sen.e: The name 'Mitsuyori', go 'Kachutei'.

sen.cmt: 号の説明補足カンマ、ピリオドをクオーテーションマークの中に入れました。

sen.j: 明治7年襲名。
sen.e: Succeeded to the name in 1874.

sen.e: Succeeded to the name in 1874.

sen.j: 京都府勧業場の御用係として活躍。
sen.e: Worked as a goyonin (officer handling domestic economy) at an industrial site in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 青花磁・彫刻・白磁を得意とする。
sen.e: His specialties were seika wares, sculptures, and white porcelains.

sen.j: 四代死去時に子息幼少のため、一時的に名跡を嗣ぐ。
sen.e: When the fourth Dohachi passed away, his son was too young therefore he temporarily took over the name.

sen.j: 先代、及び四代の陶法をつぎ、染付煎茶器に名品がある。
sen.e: Using the same technique as the fifth and fourth Dohachi, he created masterpieces of sometsuke (ceramics with blue patterns on white backgrounds) tea sets for green tea.

sen.e: The eldest son of the seventh Dohachi.

sen.j: 京都市立日吉ヶ丘高等学校美術科卒業、京都府訓練校にて轆轤成形、京都市工業試験場にて釉薬を学ぶ。
sen.e: Graduated from the Department of Art, Kyoto Municipal Hiyoshigaoka High School, studied molding with potter's wheels in Kyoto prefectural training school and glaze in Industrial Research Institute of Kyoto.
